reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Community Care and Assisted Living Act
reg:regulation.reg:title: Assisted Living Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 419/2008, April 1, 2009]

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, Act means the Community Care and Assisted Living Act.
Regardless of when an assisted living residence is registered under the Act, the registration of an assisted living residence expires on March 31 after the date of issue.
A person must pay an application fee of $250 when registering an assisted living residence if any of the following circumstances apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the assisted living residence has never been registered before;
the assisted living residence has been registered before, but

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the registrar cancelled the registration under section 27 of the Act,
the person is applying to register the assisted living residence again, and
if the registrar approves the application, it will be the first time the assisted living residence is registered since the previous registration was cancelled.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, unit means each room or set of rooms in an assisted living residence that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: used as the personal living quarters of a resident, or
shared as personal living quarters by more than one resident.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In addition to any fee payable under section 3, a person must pay a registration fee as follows each time the person registers an assisted living residence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if registration is to begin on or after March 31 but before October 1, $12.50 for each unit;
if registration is to begin on or after October 1 but before March 31 of the following year, $6.25 for each unit.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: pharmacist has the same meaning as in the Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act;
registrant includes an employee or agent of a registrant.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a registrant stores medications for residents in a central location in an assisted living residence, the registrant must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: consult with a pharmacist regarding proper procedures for medication storage and distribution,
make a record of the consultation, and
make the record available to the registrar if the registrar requests it.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a registrant stores medications for residents in a central location in an assisted living residence, the registrant must ensure the prompt return to the pharmacy that dispensed it of any medication that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is no longer in use by the resident for whom the medication was prescribed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, registrant includes an employee or agent of a registrant.
If a registrant administers medications to residents, the registrant must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: make a record of all errors in the administration of medication, and
make the record available to the registrar if the registrar requests it.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a registrant administers a medication to a resident, the registrant must report promptly to the registrar any error in the administration of the medication that causes, in whole or in part, the resident to require emergency intervention or transfer to a hospital.
